text: You approach the Overclocking Console, looking over all the available options.

script:
FireBest baOverclockCheckIfCanRepair
FireBest baOverclockDisableRepair
ShowResCost crew $crewReq metals $metalsReq true
text:
Further scans reveal nominal power is coursing through the station, several basic station functions are online. Despite this, the unusual modules appear unpowered, for reasons your sensors cannot discern.

As the engineers assess the condition of said modules, discussions are starting to form among them about the rumored Overclock Console that seems to resemble this structure. They await your decision.
options:
10:baOverclockRepair: Offload resources to reroute power to the structure
100:defaultLeave:Leave

text:
Your crews finish offloading the raw materials and you send an activation signal to the structure's distributed repair nodes.

Not a moment later, the rerouting process happened and ended swiftly. Flipping on the power switch, several movements from the structure’s modules were detected while the rusted monitors started to flicker and display the overclocking interface.

The station hails your fleet. 

"CID-IFF not received [TARGET HOSTILE] respond null // 'Greetings from Tri-Tachyon Integrated Space Industries Station unit [MY_SERIAL]. This unit has not cleared------ "INTERRUPTquery.     you are not the maker.     scanning.  Proprietary nano technology detected, entity danger/opportunity/terminate collect proprietary assets."

The comm-link dies. Your comms officer panics for a moment before the console reboots itself. You both exchange a look before assuming combat stations.

While the vast network of gantries running along and to various different parts of the station is impressive, not all of it is of the same make. Blue and silvery white lines of more recent construction, rerouted power cables and impossibly sophisticated berthing interfaces dot the station at odd angles. 

You are not the first to take interest in this station, as you recognize the telltale signs of Remnant Technology.

script:
ShowResCost crew $ba_upgrade_crewReq metals $ba_upgrade_metalsReq true heavy_machinery $ba_upgrade_machineReq alpha_core $ba_upgrade_ai_alphaReq true 115
FireBest ba_bioformCheckIfCanRepair
text:
The repair crew has reported that one of the malfunctioning modules contains remnants of outdated domain technology. Within the module are multiple pods housing what appear to be synthetic bodies - humanoid in form but not entirely human. These pods are arranged around a central pillar equipped with numerous surgical arms extending outward in all directions.

Following a thorough assessment and discussion with the team, it has been determined that repairs are feasible but will involve significant cost. However, if we choose to invest in this operation, the recovered technology could potentially be repurposed and integrated into our systems. They await your decision.

Your crews finish offloading the raw materials and you send an activation signal to the structure's distributed repair nodes.

Not a moment later, several movements from the structure’s modules were detected while the rusted monitors started to flicker and display the bioform interface.
Your tripad light up as the person information displayed.
Bioscanner indicates multiple usage of bionics on the other fleet. Reports about them can be displayed with some adjustment to our comms.

A BRM license is an artificial limit on how many bionics you can install, set in place by Domain-era megacorps and maintained on most surgical software and hardware. The records are tied to a person's genetics, and cannot be traded around like a usual blueprint license. The common known way to upgrade one's limits is to send credits through the BRM to a presumably dormant account.
Select the officer/admin to upgrade BRM tier.
A terminal displayed, waiting for you to select options for upgrading BRM.
options:
ba_BRMTier_showOpt_upgradeSelect_Opt:Upgrade to BRM Tier
ba_BRMTier_showOpt_upgradeSelected_blindEntry_Opt: Upgrade using Blind Entry
ba_BRMTier_showOpt_upgrade:Go back

text: Transfered the credits over the terminal and not a moment later, a notification shows up congratulate you on the BRM Tier upgrade.

As the entry plugged into in one of the many available ports, the terminal screen starts flickering uncontrollably. 

"$$#$%#%$ -- SUBJECT ALT#### %#$##%" - the terminal displayed briefly. 

Suddenly terminal screen returns to normal, light coming from the entry no longer blinks. A unusual message appears, congratulating you for the successful BRM capacity increase, by administrator #@#A$%#.

options: ba_ripperBionic_startOption:Approach the person at the back of local clinic

text: Standing beside a dark alley, a sketchy street vendor covered in augments eyes the area, looking for their next buyer.

You approach the individual. With a grin, they pitch their offer immediately. "Hey, I got some good stuff, just for you, with a mere markup price of $ba_markupBionicPrice. Quite a deal, don't you think?"
options:
ba_ripperBionic_selectBionics:Take a look at the offer
contact_declineBarNoContinue:Decline

script:
$ba_ripperBionic_completed = true
Call $ba_ripperBionic_ref ba_addRipperDoc_Contact
BarCMD returnFromEvent false
ba_ripperDoc_clinic purchase

text: "I got these special offers just for you"

options:
ba_ripperBionic_selectBionics:Take a look at the offer
contact_decline:Decline
